Fields.DialogueText: Mm. Mm-mm-mm.
What are you so intent on?
Enjoying this scrumptious cheesecake. And you've caught me in a sharing type of mood. Would you like a slice?

Fields.MenuText: Nah, I'm trying to watch what I eat.
Please and thank you. Who can resist cheesecake?
No, thank you. It's not my cup of tea.

Fields.DialogueText: Why do you need to go on a diet all of a sudden? Come and enjoy yourself. You never know when those Morganas will show up and interrupt.
Nobody, that's who. I bet even a Morgana would have trouble saying no.
Suit yourself, Captain, but you really don't know what you're missing.
Whew. Enough. I gotta make this last longer... somehow.
Spoken like a true conservationist.
It's a sacrifice, Captain. But Future Hull will thank me. A little self-denial is no different from planting a tree.
While we're talking about trees, you're missing the forest for them!
The forest of... cheesecake?
Oh, now you're just being difficult. My sisters do the same thing when they want to get a rise out of me.
That must be annoying.
Nah, it's just what sisters do. If we can't handle a little ribbing in the family, how are we supposed to take it from strangers?
@BATTLE
I can think of several ways those things are different.
*ALARM*
Never thought of war as a family business.
You oughta start, Cap. You're one of us!
That must be the third time this week I've seen you clean that rifle.
The Winchester Model 70. This is the best hunting rifle, no matter what the old guard says. It deserves the best.
For some reason I expected you to be a flintlock kind of girl.
It's all about having the right tool for the job. Rifles have come a long way since old lady Constitution was kicking around.
I'm still trying to decide. I mean, where do you go from a moose? A bear? Where else?

Fields.MenuText: What about something from Africa, like a giraffe?
What about a shark?
What about a giant snake?

Fields.DialogueText: Fish in a barrel. They're so tall and lumbering. Where's the sport in that?
Eh, too easy. Chum the waters and they fall right into your lap.
Hmm... never had snake meat before. It'd make some damn fine boots, I tell you what.
I just need to shoot something so I know I still have it, you know?
You're right, Cap. I shouldn't be so maudlin.
No kidding. Morganas can smell it.
Ha! They ain't nothing but a bunch of scavengers. Let's show 'em how a real hunter fights!
@BATTLE
That being said, my namesake sure knew how to dress. Still would, if he were around.
So what's the hunt now? More moose?
Still have what? If there's a right Belle for the job, it's you. We know that already.
*ALARM*
Don't ever tell her I called her that, by the way.
Take a look at this, Cap!
Let me see those binoculars... Oh, I see.
Isn't it a wonderful sight?
Sure is... if I knew what I was supposed to be looking at.
It's the bald eagle nest, you turkey! Isn't that something? Bald eagles are so rare right now. Of all the things to be on the brink of losing...
Don't get me started on all the recently extinct species either. Aldo Leopold says we are in a very critical time right now.
You've mentioned him before. The conservationist, right?
Morganas! We can't let them spook the eagles!
@BATTLE
Cap! I haven't seen the parent eagles return to their nest... I hope they weren't injured or killed during battle.
They might return soon.
I don't think so. I don't see any sign of them. Usually one parent will sit on the eggs, but they're not around!

Fields.MenuText: What should we do?
We should just leave the nest and let nature take its course.
We should get those eggs, is what we should do! Those eagles need our help.

Fields.DialogueText: I think we should send an officer out to get those eggs. The species needs all the help it can get right now.
There's nothing natural about the Morganas, Captain.
You read my mind, Cap. I'm going to send an officer out now to shimmy up the tree and get the eggs.
You're sure we need to interfere?
Yes, Miss Hull?
My sister Dewey isn't around to help us, but I know you're a capable person for the job.
Climb up that tree along the shore and bring back those bald eagle eggs. Be careful not to break them on your way back down!
I tell you what: things were really swell when the first Roosevelt was in office. Now there was someone who respected nature.
*ALARM*
Enough birdwatching. We've got company.
We already have. This battle is what caused the parents to go MIA. I can't let the symbol of my country become extinct.
You! Lieutenant!
Yes, ma'am!
I hope you know what you're doing.
For these eagles' sake... I'm going to have to.
Hull, something seems different.
You didn't add anything new to your uniform, did you?
Oh, something is different. Let me see if you can guess what it is.

Fields.MenuText: You changed your perfume from lavender.
Did you change your hair?
Don't take this the wrong way, but... is something going on in your... chest area?

Fields.DialogueText: Nah, lavender's just who I am. I'm not about to go confusing the crew.
Ha-ha! As if my hair could be tamed anytime soon. There are some horses even I can't break.
Oh, so you noticed! Don't worry, Cap, you're in the clear.
Well, I have to spill the beans, Cap. I'm expecting.
What!?
A couple of bald eagles, that is! Until the incubator is built, I'm keeping these babies warm. There ain't no better place right now than my bra. It's like the cups were designed for eagle eggs.
I know Playtex makes parachute slings for airmen pigeons. They should really make some eagle egg bras. I swear, there could be a market for this.
For a very specific type of conservationist.
Oh, hell. I'll be right back, Captain. There's no fighting in this thing.
@BATTLE
So I commission a custom order from them. It wouldn't be the first military contract they've taken.
I don't think it's automatically a military contract just because a warship's paying.
Or Esquire.
If a warship's paying. I think I could sell this idea to the Department of the Interior.
Hell, I'd sell it to Pravda if it'd save these little guys.
*ALARM*
Help me with these lights, Cap - I'm finishing up the incubator for the eagle eggs. Sure is easier than carrying them around in my bra all day.
Where do you want them?
Oh, just rig the lights over here. I have them hooked up to a thermostat. If the temperature gets too hot or too cold, the lights turn off.
What kind of contraption is this? These eggs look like they're in a torture device.
Oh, that's my egg turner. See, eagle eggs need to be turned every hour. Do you think a woman like me has that kind of free time on my hands?
Can't you appear wherever you please on this ship?
Every hour, on the hour? I'm patient, but I'm not risking a slip-up.
Just think! Soon we'll have little eaglets screeching for food at all hours.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, brilliant.
Sounds like a fun challenge!

Fields.DialogueText: It's my duty to my country. I can't let eagles go the way of the Carolina parakeet.
That's the spirit, Cap! When I think of flocks of eagles way in the future, it doesn't seem so hard.
Let's get these lights attached to the thermostat and the egg turner hooked up... there. Before you know it we'll have eaglets on our hands.
*ALARM*
And not a moment too soon. We are not losing a single soul to these Morganas!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: As long as you're the one feeding them.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd trust nobody else with their welfare. Well, not at first.
The wonders of modern technology. Now you have time for life and death.
Human or otherwise.
It's a big world, Cap. Let's keep it that way.
Hey, Cap! Let me ask you something. What do you think about these flowers?
They sure look exotic. What type of flowers are those?

This radial looking one is Osteopermum, which is from South Africa. This white one that looks like a bride's veil, that's Seeplakkie. You can tell it's a desert flower because of the waxy, thick leaves.
And then there's this one. It's called a beach pumpkin, but I think it should be called the sand dune brooch.
It does look a little like something someone would wear to a dance, doesn't it?
And it grows on beaches. These things practically name themselves.
I don't know which one Farragut would like more. Help me decide, will you, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: That Eastern Parmesan one looks beautiful. I think your sister would like that.
That Seeplakkie is a tough plant. Aren't you always saying you and your sisters are tough?
Maybe that pumpkin brooch thing. It looks serious and I seem to recall you saying Farragut was very serious.

Fields.DialogueText: Osteo... ah, never mind. They're also known as African daisies. She loves purple, now that you mention it.
The Farragut sisters are top of the line in range and firepower.
I can see her wearing a sea pumpkin, or at least hanging it on her wall. It looks more serious, just like her! I guess that comes with being the oldest sister.
You must come from a thoughtful family.
We try. I think it's easier to keep in touch when you're split up, if we're honest.
@BATTLE
Counterintuitive, but I'm intrigued. Why?
Challenge. Nothing worth having is easy to keep. I love being with my sisters, don't get me wrong. But you pour so much more of yourself into a letter than a simple hello.
So that's what that novella in the manila envelope was.
Can't help it. There's a lot to write about.
Never a dull moment with Morganas about.
*ALARM*
Oh, I was talking about you, Captain. But they do their part too. I know which I prefer.
Captain, I've been thinking about these eggs.
Are they going to hatch?
I am certain they will, but I need to candle them again soon to see how far out we are.
Then what seems to be the trouble?
Well, when these eggs hatch, we'll have two impressionable eagles on our hands. I don't want humans to be the first thing they see. They'd imprint on us.
We're certainly not going to have them stick around forever.
And if they imprint on people, they won't show any fear. I don't want them harassing fishermen. That will undo all our hard work.
What do you suggest, then?
We're going to need to make some bald eagle costumes. This way the birds imprint on other eagles instead of humans.

Fields.MenuText: Won't a plush animal do?
You can wear an eagle costume, but count me out.
I've never pretended to be an eagle before. Sounds exciting!

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... if we made hand puppets or something out of taxidermied eagles, sure. We'd need to have them sit on the eggs, too.
Bald eagles usually have two parents, you know. The more believable this is, the better for the future of the species.
Some things you need a bird's-eye view of.
I'll think about the costume thing, Captain. We can probably get away with puppets.
@BATTLE
It'll be fewer feathers to work with, too.
Still, the thought of you in one of those costumes really tickles me. Can you imagine?
You can if you like. You're not half bad at drawing.
*ALARM*
Challenge accepted! You're getting into that costume one way or another...
Look at this! Isn't it cute?
The stuffed eagles! I didn't think they would arrive so soon.
Oh, they're so soft and cuddly. I think the chicks are going to like them.
I'm putting them with the incubator. Oh, and Captain... I need to tell you something.
Uh-oh, what is it?
I'm really proud of you.
Just trying to help.
And I appreciate it. Here you are, helping me hatch these eagle eggs. Shoot, you even agreed to help feed the chicks wearing an eagle costume.
My point stands. You're one in a million, you know that?

Fields.MenuText: I'm still on the fence about it. Will it really work?
Aww, shucks. You're making me blush!
I'd do anything for you, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: It's been done before. Who better to save an American symbol than an American girl?
Don't blush, Cap! It's contagious!
You really would? While we're on the subject of eagles, I'm sure you know how they feed their young...
Anyway, I'm glad they came today of all days. It's ominous out there.
The sky does look rather dark. What do you think that means?
Just a change in the pressure system. I was talking about the Morganas. Sometimes I think they can smell happiness.
@BATTLE
Within reason.
Only joking, Captain. We can cheat a little bit.
They almost have me fooled.
I bargained you down to puppetry.
Don't let it get away!
What's going on?
Catch that egg! Don't let it roll away! There it goes!
Ah! Get it!
It's rolling into the galley! Everyone, stop that egg, but don't break it!
It's too fast! How does an egg roll this fast?
What's all the noise? Can't a girl get some- gah! An egg!
Whew. Thank goodness you're here.
Teleportation has its perks. Let's get this little guy back into the incubator.

Fields.MenuText: How did that egg roll away?
Is the egg going to be all right?
I could really go for an omelet right about now...

Fields.DialogueText: A rogue wave from the storm. I said sailors take warning. They didn't.
Let's see... yep, looks fine to  me. Thank goodness they're tough. Now, if we were raising snakes we'd really be out of luck.
It'll be seasoned with gunpowder if one of these eggs goes missing.
*ALARM*
Don't hurt the officer too badly.
Wouldn't dream of it, Captain. Some cleaning duty once the eagles hatch ought to straighten her out.
@BATTLE
And... gotcha!
When this fight's over, remind me to check the schedule and see who was watching the eggs.
Why is it so dark in here? Hull, are you in here?
Hmm... yep. Let's see...
Hull, I can smell your lavender perfume.
Oh! Hey, Cap. I didn't see you come in.
What are you doing here in the dark?
I'm candling the eggs. I need to be in the dark so I can see through them.
See, it works this way...
Ahh! Don't shine that flashlight in my eye!
Oops, sorry about that. So what I do is I take this flashlight and hold it to the bottom of the egg, like so. Then I look for shadows and vascularity. Without either of those, there's no chick.
How far along are those eggs?
We don't have much longer!

Fields.MenuText: Why is it called candling?
How will you know when to be there when they hatch?
I don't know if I'm ready to have baby birds to worry about.

Fields.DialogueText: People used to use candles to do this. I can't say I miss that way of doing things.
I've worked up a round-the-clock watch schedule. Don't worry - I'm not taking anyone away from their duties.
Don't worry, Cap. I've got plenty of the crew on board with this. A lot of them aren't even American!
Can we turn the lights on now?
Sure thing, Cap! Let me just get up here...
Whoa, that's bright.
Last time I blind you, I promise.
*ALARM*
Can't they let my eyes adjust?
You sure you need it? I bet by now you could take these Morganas with your eyes closed.
Your confidence in me is appreciated. Let's not test it.
@BATTLE
Captain! Come check this out!
What's going on, Hull?
Come listen to these eggs!

Fields.MenuText: What am I looking for?
Are they hatching?

Fields.DialogueText: You hear that, Cap? It's almost time!
Not quite, but soon!
I hear... peeping?
The eggs are very close to hatching. Any day now. You know what this means?
Food, and lots of it.
Usually when the parents hear that peeping sound, they go out and scare up some fish for the chicks.

Fields.MenuText: Can it wait?

Fields.DialogueText: Nature doesn't wait! We've got to keep up with her.
Hopefully the Morganas don't scare the fish off.
@BATTLE
Parents meaning us.
Who else? Oh! And don't forget to mash up the fish once we catch them.
*ALARM*
Not to worry, Captain. I think there's some on ice down in the galley. The fresher the better, of course.
They're lucky to have you.
As eagle parents go, we're not half bad.
Give or take a few feathers.
Don't tempt me! You know I collect those...
Hull, there you- whoa! Watch it!
Casting a fishing line here. You might want to watch out!
Isn't there a warning you could say? Like "fore" or something?
That's golf. Nowhere near as interesting as fishing.

Fields.MenuText: But fishing is so boring.
You don't like golf?
I suppose it's fun to pass the time.

Fields.DialogueText: If I agreed with you, it'd tell you what I think about golf.
Flattening acres and acres of good land so fat cats can walk around and knock things into holes? I'll pass.
It's good for sitting and thinking. Sometimes you even get dinner out of it.
Now fishing's not my strongest suit, but I'll try anything once.
Lots of patience in fishing. I'd think you'd excel at that.
So would I, Cap, but I have the worst luck catching stuff out here. I don't know what it is.
When you're hunting, you pull the trigger when you see your prey. Maybe fishing doesn't come naturally because you can't see below the water's surface.
Could be. If I were one of those submarine girls that wouldn't be a problem.
You can't see underwater?
I don't really mind that, to be honest. You never know what might swim your way. Just gotta be around to look.
That's as good a time as any to call it quits. All I've caught are a couple of boots.
@BATTLE
I'm not built for it. Damndest thing.
I admit I don't know how one would get good at fishing. To me it just seems like a lot of waiting for the right moment.
*ALARM*
That's definitely not what I had in mind.
At least there's two of them.
Both for the left foot. At least if you asked me to dance I'd be all set.
You don't dance?
Not well. But I might be persuaded when we're not under fire.
Fore!
It sounds silly, but I appreciate the warning. Still looking for food?
It's not my shift to look after the eggs, but I can still help them.
Don't be afraid to give yourself a break.
Oh, I can't stop thinking about them, Captain. Is there anything I've missed? Are they going to have to get their land legs once we have to get rid of them?
You're right, Captain. I'm just a nervous nester. Literally.
Wait, is that-
Ha! It's a fish! Lemme just reel it... there!
Let me see. What type of fish is that?
Looks like a little tuna.
We'll need more than that to feed the eaglets.
Then grab a rod and help a Belle out! I've been meaning to get you out here for a spell anyway.
*ALARM*
Another day, I guess.
@BATTLE
Eagles fly. I don't think that's going to be a problem.
You and me both. I'm glad I've got you to help.

Fields.MenuText: That just means you're going to be a good eagle parent.

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, fresh is best. Besides, it'll mean more if we catch it ourselves.

Fields.MenuText: I thought we had meat in the galley.

Fields.DialogueText: They don't relate to this like I do. Not even the American ones.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about it. The crew isn't.

Fields.DialogueText: And soon. I wouldn't be opposed to a fish dinner in the near future.
That too, Captain. That too.
Captain... Captaaain!
Hull!? Why are you waking me up? I was in the middle of a nap.
The eggs are hatching!
Why didn't you say so? Let's go watch!
No, that wouldn't be practical. I don't want to spook the poor things with too many people. I just had to share it!

Fields.MenuText: What about imprinting on us?
Do you ever sleep?
I'm going back to sleep. The eaglets will be there when I wake up.

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't have to happen right away. And I know you need your beauty sleep.
Like a giraffe. Short naps throughout the day.
Gotcha. I can't wait for you to meet them!
Wait, are those feathers?
The right tool for the job, remember, Captain? That includes your uniform!
You certainly dress up nice.
Oh, thank you! You really like it?
Lots. Goodnight.
*ALARM*
Hull, come on. We're up.
... Just fine, Cap. Let me go check on the chicks and I'll be right there with you.
@BATTLE
Captain?
I'm glad you're helping. I'm fighting for the Fleet... but my home is America. Any way I can help a symbol of my home, I will.
And... I'm really glad we're doing this togeth-
Damn it! They caught us napping!
Hull, is everything all right?
Okay, Hull. Let's see these chicks.
Sure thing, Cap! But before we go inside, you need to put this on.
Like a glove? Wait, is this one of those stuffed eagles?
Yeah! We can't let the eaglets know we're anything but eagle parents. I don't want them imprinting on humans.

Fields.MenuText: All right, I'll play along.
Are they really going to fall for it?
It's not too late to keep them?

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent! Time to bring the eagle parents back from hunting.
There's no instinct so sharp you can't fool it.
Believe me, I've thought about it. But they're not mine to keep.
I have to say this wasn't high on my list of things I thought I'd be doing after you Belles appeared.
I got that far. But... hand puppets? An aviary? Who could have predicted this?
You've never known anyone who became absolutely determined to make something come true?
*ALARM*
Wait, what I meant was-
Ha! Only teasing, Captain. People do that too.
@BATTLE
What can I say? We're full of surprises.
Of course I have. I'd argue that I'm captain because of that kind of determination.
See? We understand each other. I may be a warship, but I'm a person too. If something's important to me, I chase it to the ends of the earth.
Like a hunter walking down a gazelle.
Exactly like that! When were you going to tell me you knew hunting history?
I read here and there. Just things you pick up along the way. Something interesting sticks in your mind and you never know what might remind you of it.
Well, if this is our last day on earth, I'm glad I remind you of something interesting.
Gloves off, then. You take care of the eaglets and catch up on the bridge.
Okay, gloves back on. Time for the eaglets to meet their other parent.
Here they are!
Gah! Those are them?
Aren't they adorable?
They look... old. Their eyes aren't even open, and there are no feathers on them. Why are they so ugly?
Well, just wait until they're a little older. That's when they're at their most majestic. It's a little like that one F. Scott Fitzgerald story.
How do you feed them?
We take a piece of cut-up fish, put it in our beaks, and make the food call. "Peeeep-peeep".
So that's how you do it. Beaks? All right. I see you've sewed it so I can... ugh, that feels vile.
Just hand it to them, Captain. They'll thank you for it.

Fields.MenuText: No thanks. I think I have a touch of the flu today.
Why not?
Why can't I use my hand instead?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the quickest onset flu I think I've ever seen. We ought to burn your stuff to keep it from spreading.
There you go! Just hand it to them. They'll smell it.
You are using your hand. There's just an eagle around it. This is for their own good.
When do their eyes open?
It takes about a week and a half. Just make sure you're making the sound.
*ALARM*
Well, that ain't the right sound.
Got it under control?
Why don't you stick around this time? I can run the show solo for a few minutes.
@BATTLE
Hull, you look tired.
Yeah... I feel pretty tired, Cap.
Didn't you nap, at least?
Those eaglets are on a strict feeding schedule. I can be there in a flash, but doing it every couple of hours is tiring.
That's a lot of work. Are you sure you want to go through with raising them?
Hull? Hull!
Sorry, Cap! What did you say? Nodded off there.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you have a proper rest. I can feed the eaglets a couple of times.
Maybe it's time to find the eaglets a new home.
Now you're making me sleepy.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I may take you up on that for once.
We can't do that until they're old enough to travel. I'm working on it, but it'll take time.
One of us has to be awake, Captain. What if they need one of their parents?
What was your plan to get them back into the wild, anyway?
Isn't it illegal to own bald eagles?
That's part of why it's taking so long. Someone made the mistake of asking whether US laws apply to non-humans.
Maritime laws, probably.
They'd be crazy to try and fault you for saving them.
Don't even get me started on the citizenship question. Anyway, it's a whole can of worms I wish I could feed to the eaglets.
I wrote the Department of the Interior about the situation. They're still discussing it.
It takes a special kind of crazy to want to run a country. I'm not too worried, though. Imagine the PR nightmare.
Fining a physical manifestation of the American way for protecting an American symbol? Political suicide.
I've never had much respect for formalities. I just want to get these birds to a safe place.
*ALARM*
Despite evidence to the contrary.
I'd say there's no safer place than aboard you, Hull.
Feel like destroying some evidence?
@BATTLE
What are you writing? Pestering the Interior Department?
Nah, that was Tuesday. I bet Secretary Ickes appreciates having a Belle for a pen pal.
No, I'm just keeping my sisters up to date. Pretty much the same letter seven times, with variations. I wonder what they're up to?
I'm sure Macdonough is up to something interesting. She ain't the type to stick to one thing, but she's always finding something new.
She your favorite?
But pre-war... I spent a lot of time with Dale, since she was constructed around the same time.
What a showoff she is... She's a regular fitness queen, you know. Like it's her patriotic duty to lift her own ship.
No way! Even the strongest Belles can't lift their own weight. But she can definitely rock the boat, so to speak.
I was actually just finishing up my letter to her. Now to slip them some flowers and feathers.

Fields.MenuText: What's the law say about eagle feathers?
It's nice to be able to share your interests with family.
What type of flower?

Fields.DialogueText: If they're not attached to an eagle, they're fair game.
And cheap to mail. When you're as into smithing as Worden is... well, your gifts tend to weigh more.
They've all got preferences. Dale's getting this horsemint. Something about that square stem really appeals to her.
*ALARM*
Oh, this battle's going in this crop of letters. I always leave room just in case!
@BATTLE
Captain! I don't like to play favorites, you know. I love all of my sisters.
You must have a lot in common.
Not really. Where I like to wait for just the right shot, Dale wades into a fight and gives as good as she gets.
Can she?
Hear that? You've already got something to put in the next letter.
I bet those letters would make great reading. War narratives from a ship... imagine that.
Maybe. The novelty would wear off pretty quick, though. Skip over the complaints about boiler trouble and we're soldiers like any of you humans.
Mail for you, Hull. There's a couple from your sisters!
Is that a good thing?
She reads a lot into your small talk, eh?
I mean, look at this. She's asking all about my plans for the eagles, my performance in battle... even my health. I don't ask whether she's eating properly!

Fields.MenuText: Don't you?
I thought you'd be talking eagles to anyone who'd listen.
You don't like to boast at least a little?

Fields.DialogueText: Why would I? I'm not her mother. I just want to know what she's up to.
She's impatient. There's only so much I know until the Interior Department makes its final decision.
Not when she's so critical. Acting like she's the top of our class... ooh, it makes me want to eat something alive.
Anyway. What's important is that the eagles are doing just fine.
Their eyes are open! They sure grow up fast, don't they?
They're already eating half their weight in fish each day. They'll probably fledge right after the feds pick them up.
Now what's so funny about that?
Oh! Let's see.
Looks like... Dewey and Dale. Well, I know what to expect from Dewey.
I love her, Cap, the way I love any of my sisters. But she can be so nosy!
Half their weight? Do we have enough on hand to keep that up?
Math's not a strength of mine, but we're cutting it close. Now, if a certain someone would help me fish...
Ha! I'd love to.
The greatest destroyer from the greatest class... It's still strange to me that a ship wouldn't be good at fishing.
You humans are descended from persistence hunters. Get back to me when you can walk a whole day in the summer heat for your dinner.
We don't need to do that anymore.
And I don't need to fish for the eaglets. But it always pays to have another tool in your belt.
*ALARM*
I wasn't kidding, Captain. When the smoke clears, we're going fishing!
@BATTLE
Letter for you, Miss Hull.
Thank you! You can just call me Hull, you know.
No hard feelings about the egg, then?
Of course not. And the aviary's never looked cleaner!
Hull. Lieutenant.
Ah, Captain, I'll let you two be. By your leave.
Us two?
What's got you so suspicious?
I just didn't want her to think-
Oh! Belay that, Captain. The Interior Department finally wrote back!

Fields.MenuText: At least the government's willing to take them off our hands.
I was really starting to like them.
They're keeping a great parent out of the game.

Fields.DialogueText: One less thing to worry about. But I kind of enjoyed worrying about them.
I knew you'd come around. At least we can commiserate about it now.
I did right by them for as long as I could. That's what really matters.
Are you going to be all right?
Just fine, Cap. Although...
What's up?
You still want to go fishing now and again? Even though there won't be eaglets to feed?
@BATTLE
What do they say?
"Pursuant to the Migratory Bird Treaty Act of 1918," blah blah blah, "unique position and distinguished service therein executed," blah blah blah...
Well, I figured this would be the case. They found a preserve in Newport News for these eaglets. But I'm not to take on any more.
*ALARM*
I'll make it short: yes, of course.
You're real sweet, Cap. I'm glad you're in my corner.
These eaglets look more like porcupines than birds right now.
Pin feathers. Don't break them; they're full of blood right now. Eventually the blood dissipates and the sheathing dries away.
Soon they'll be covered in real feathers and they'll try to fly.
At least we won't have to chop up fish as much. These things are bottomless pits.
They eat a lot now, but when they fledge, they'll lose some of their body weight until they put more muscle on their keels.

Fields.MenuText: Eagles have keels?
You're taking it remarkably well.
When do they get that famous bald head?

Fields.DialogueText: Flying birds have keels, just like on a ship. It's the same principle. We aren't so different in that way.
I got the worst of my crying done in the middle of the night. If the sailors start swapping ghost stories, you know who to blame.
Four or five years down the road, Cap. The war might be over by then... hopefully.
Now it's just a race to Virginia to get these little symbols of freedom home.
Chasing it's one thing. You just have to decide what to do when you get there.
Shame we won't get to see them fledge.
I think they might have done pretty well for themselves aboard you.
If you love something, let it go. We were what the eaglets needed when they hatched. Now they're moving on to somewhere they can really thrive.
I think we can both relate to that.
I don't know about that. Ever see how big those eagle nests get? Where would they put one? And what would they even make it out of?
Not to mention the risk of carrying them around in a war zone, after they've started flying and hunting. No, they belong on land.
You mean how Belles belong in the sea?
That's where a ship is meant to be. But as long as we want to talk to each other, to travel and learn... I think humans belong here too.
Well, what you need, you build. As far as I'm concerned, you've earned the right. Just be sure you use it responsibly.
I guess there's more to progress than just chasing the horizon, isn't there?
*ALARM*
If you get there.
Shouldn't be a problem.
@BATTLE
Won't be long now.
You keep saying that, but we've been out here for hours without a bite.

Fields.MenuText: We can do something else if you're bored.

Fields.DialogueText: No, there's no place I'd rather be. I've just really been craving fish.
I wasn't talking about the fish, actually. The Department of the Interior said they'd be by this week for the handoff now that we're in the vicinity.
So it'll be just us.
And the crew.
Well, them too.
I've been thinking about what you said. Chasing the horizon and all that.
Oh?
Well, you're a conservationist. We're obviously supposed to clean up after ourselves.
So the Morganas don't have to.
Morbid, but I take your point.
Just joking. I wouldn't wish them on anyone.
As well as letting eagles be eagles.
True.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I still think you've got the patience for it. You've stayed in one place for hours with your rifle.
Just a little longer. It's when you've almost given up that the fish start biting.

Fields.DialogueText: Because I know what I'm hunting! Who knows what I'll catch, if anything?
The fish can sense resignation? Don't tell me they've gone over to the Morganas.
Or whether it'll fit my feet.
Shush.
You have to admit they're giving us a common enemy, though.
Maybe that's what really shows how far we've come. Making it easier for other people to follow.
But I do follow you, Captain. You might even say I enjoy it.
*ALARM*
Even when it's into battle?
Especially then.
That's goodbye to the eagles.
They're in good hands, Cap. I've already done my mourning.
All of it?
... Almost all.
Not all of them! Just Isaac. And Derby. And Laurel...

Fields.MenuText: Any longer and the government would have had to pry them from your hands.
Thank goodness. They were getting too big for the ship.
Are they going to keep their names?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm helping save the species! I'm allowed to be sentimental.
Some things even I can't provide, no matter how I might want to.
Yep! I even named one Harold, after the Interior Secretary. He appreciated that.
Promise me one thing?
Promise me we'll come back and visit.
That's a big ask. We'll have to survive the war.
You named them, didn't you.
What's that?
I know.
I'll have to still be your captain.
Sounds good.
We'll have to go on all kinds of adventures and stick by each other through peace and war, no matter what.
Yep. That's the plan. I decided on you a while ago.
You did pick me as your captain.
And... maybe as something more?
More than a friend?
Read my mind.
*ALARM*
Here come the Morganas to congratulate us.
Thank goodness! I'd forgotten the fireworks.
@BATTLE
Soooo?
So?
We've still got one more stop on the East Coast, you know.

Fields.MenuText: Short notice to visit the president, isn't it?
I'd almost forgotten about the moose.
A beach vacation would be nice.

Fields.DialogueText: He'd make time, but that's not what I'm talking about!
That's why you have me around!
Well, that too. Not that I could get close enough to shore without running aground. Anyway, that's not the point!
Our taxidermist in New York wired me while we were in Newport News. I can't wait to go and pick up my moose!
Things can take ages from the taxidermist. It's worth the wait, though. No rushing art.
I might be in a celebratory mood once we're off duty.
Telling the future, Cap?
That's going to look impressive!
Now I wish I'd spent that time figuring out your fireplace.
Life's like that, Cap. Lying in wait for an opportunity... it's like a hunt. It'll come around if it takes all day.
And if you're paying attention.
Second nature. I know you're always thinking about me, too.
You're sure?
Don't think I haven't noticed you on the bridge, Cap. Practicing your steps, passing it off all casual...
I did promise you a dance.
And just like the fireplace, I'll get it. Maybe not today, but when the moment strikes... bang!
Let's say a little bird told me.
Okay, closer... closer... you can open your eyes now!
Night-blooming orchids! Where did you find these?
Picked them up in port. I thought they might look nice arranged among some of the-
You didn't!
Cap... you saved some of the down from the eagles?
I couldn't remember having seen the flowers in your scrapbook. And I figured, you know, in case you weren't ready to say goodbye to the eaglets... you could keep a part of them with you.
I don't think I ever could be. Not right away, anyway. I... thank you, Captain. Thank you so much.

Fields.MenuText: It's not much, but it'll look nice in your quarters.

Fields.DialogueText: Not much? It's everything! Ahem... it's a lot of things. All of them good.
Oh, she had us pegged from day one.
And as it happens, I also got you something.
Did you draw this? It's beautiful!
That image of you in an eagle suit was just too good to let go. I thought I'd keep it for a rainy day.
And somehow you still manage to make me look good.
Can't help it. I try and put the best of myself in what I do.
As eagles and eagle-related things go, you're batting a thousand.
And the person inside the eagle costume?

Fields.MenuText: And next time we're in New York, cheesecake's on me.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, now you're just spoiling me. Not that I'm opposed.

Fields.MenuText: This might give Dewey something to talk about.

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly, Dewey's going to be so smug.
Planning on letting her find out from your sisters?
Nah. She can be smug. It doesn't change the fact that I like you.
Approves.
*ALARM*
Think we can get our war faces on?
I kind of like us as we are. There's power in protecting beauty on the battlefield. If I've learned one thing from all this, it's that.
Challenge accepted.
@BATTLE
